alert.note: Alert for Kandiyohi; Sibley (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 13 at 7:35PM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...LIGHT SNOW ENDING THIS EVENING... ...DANGEROUSLY COLD WIND CHILLS INTO NEXT WEEK... .Powdery light snow will gradually diminish through the rest of this evening, with little to no additional snow accumulation. Northwest wind gusts of 30 to 40 mph will lead to areas of blowing snow and reduced visibility, especially across western and southern Minnesota. Meanwhile, confidence remains high that dangerously cold wind chills will follow tonight, with widespread values of 25 to 40 degrees below zero likely through early next week. A Wind Chill Warning is in effect for western and southern Minnesota tonight through Sunday morning. A Wind Chill Advisory is in effect for eastern Minnesota and western Wisconsin tonight through Sunday morning. After Sunday morning, Wind Chill Advisories continue across central and southern Minnesota through Tuesday morning as wind chill values will remain between 20 and 35 degrees below zero most of the day on Sunday and Monday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON SUNDAY TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of less than one inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the first Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Kandiyohi and Sibley Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight CST tonight. For the first Wind Chill Advisory, until 9 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Warning, until noon CST Sunday. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from noon Sunday to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
